str2: However, nevertheless, but, except that, yet. From pleion; moreover, i.e. Albeit, save that, rather, yet.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Hated, hostile; subst: an enemy. From a primary echtho; hateful; usually as a noun, an adversary.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To do that which is good. From agathopoios; to be a well-doer.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To lend; mid: I borrow. From daneion; to loan on interest; reflexively, to borrow.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To give up in despair, despair of; I hope to receive from or in return. From apo and elpizo; to hope out, i.e. Fully expect.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
(a) pay, wages, salary, (b) reward, recompense, punishment. Apparently a primary word; pay for service, good or bad.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Much, many; often.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Highest, most high, the heights. Superlative from the base of hupsos; highest, i.e. the Supreme, or the heavens.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Useful, gentle, pleasant, kind. From chraomai; employed, i.e. useful.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Ungrateful, ungracious, unpleasing. Thankless, i.e. Ungrateful.
And, even, also, namely.
Evil, bad, wicked, malicious, slothful.
